title: Toolchain 'aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu' does not come with cc for official Docker Image.
body: I'm trying to build a docker image for a Raspberry Pi 4 which uses Trunk to build a web page. Pretty common use-case, right? I would think so. It doesn't build on Arm64v8 architecture and fails to find cc. I checked `/usr/local/rustup/toolchains/1.60.0-aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu/bin` and confirmed cc does not exist, but gcc/g++ is installed. Here was my Dockerfile: ```docker FROM rust as builder RUN rustup target add wasm32-unknown-unknown RUN cargo install trunk # <--- BUILD FAILS HERE RUN trunk build ``` I expected this small example to build. Instead: ``` note: Error while loading /usr/local/rustup/toolchains/1.60.0-aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu/bin/cc: No such file or directory #0 183.5 #0 183.5 #0 187.1 error: failed to compile `trunk v0.14.0`, intermediate artifacts can be found at `/tmp/cargo-installzc7X1O` #0 187.1 #0 187.1 Caused by: #0 187.1 build failed ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` #6 [3/6] RUN rustc --version --verbose #6 1.773 rustc 1.60.0 (7737e0b5c 2022-04-04) #6 1.773 binary: rustc #6 1.773 commit-hash: 7737e0b5c4103216d6fd8cf941b7ab9bdbaace7c #6 1.773 commit-date: 2022-04-04 #6 1.773 host: aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu #6 1.773 release: 1.60.0 #6 1.773 LLVM version: 14.0.0 ```
